data.title: Ranking, Courses and Scholarships
data.meta_description: UWE Bristol profile. Information on undergraduate and postgraduate courses; rankings; accommodation and services for international students.
data.text:
UWE Bristol Overview

UWE Bristol is a modern, vibrant university, offering widely respected courses focused on boosting employability. As part of the University Alliance—a group of UK universities engaged with the business sector—UWE Bristol ensures its education is employment-oriented. The university maintains strong links with industry partners, enhancing student opportunities for work placements and mentorship, and cultivates an entrepreneurial environment. Its network with employers enables the offering of degrees that are acknowledged by industries for their relevance.

Teaching and Employability at UWE

Nestled in one of the UK's most prosperous and vibrant cities, UWE Bristol is a hub of academic excellence, hosting a diverse body of over 38,000 students from 166 countries. The university's campus life goes beyond the norm, delivering an exceptional student experience that has earned it a 'Gold' rating. More than half of UWE's courses come with professional body recognition, while 76% of its research is acknowledged for its significant impact.

The university's three primary faculties - Arts, Technology and Environment; Business and Law; and Health, Science and Society- testify to its comprehensive educational offerings. UWE’s practice-led teaching is designed to arm graduates with the skills needed to thrive globally, contributing to their impressive employability outcomes.

UWE Bristol distinguishes itself with initiatives like the University Enterprise Zone, the Distinguished Address Series featuring external experts, international talent programs, and practical work opportunities. These, combined with robust academic, career guidance, and pastoral care, underscore the university's commitment to student and staff welfare.

UWE Bristol fosters a culturally rich and supportive atmosphere by embracing equity, diversity, and inclusivity. Its outstanding commitment to sustainability is integral to its 2030 Strategy, which aims to confront climate and ecological challenges while aligning with the United Nations’ Sustainable Development Goals.

UWE Campuses

Spanning across Frenchay, Glenside, and City Campus, UWE Bristol's campuses are each a short bus ride apart, offering their own unique qualities. Over the recent five years, UWE Bristol has invested £300 million in upgrading its facilities, transforming them into cutting-edge environments. This substantial investment reflects the university's dedication to creating the best possible setting for students and staff, nurturing their potential, and inspiring innovation.

UWE Fees

Undergraduate courses at UWE Bristol begin from £15,850 per year. Postgraduate programmes begin at £13,750, rising to £18,000 depending on course selection.

UWE Bristol Location

UWE Bristol is based in the southwest’s largest city, Bristol, thriving economically and creatively. Bristol is the ideal place to live and study, with its rich history, vibrant culture and nearby countryside and coast. It is also a top retail destination, with a great selection of independent shops, cafes, and restaurants.

Based on the 2023 "key facts" updates from the Bristol City Council, Bristol is the South West's largest city and a vital UK's 'Core City', is rapidly growing with a mid-2022 population of 479,200, making it the second fastest-growing city in the last decade. It boasts high productivity and education levels, with a robust economy that withstood 2022's peak inflation.

Workers enjoy above-average earnings of £34,215 in a city comprising over 22,500 businesses, predominantly micro-sized but also including small, medium, and large enterprises. With a student population of 43,700, Bristol is a hub of education and cultural diversity, home to residents of 185 nationalities and speakers of 90 languages. The city celebrates a 28.4% minority ethnic population, reflecting its dynamic and inclusive community. Bristol's resilience is rooted in its diverse and economically vibrant character, driven by technological, media, and aerospace engineering industries.

Bristol is ideally located just 75 minutes by train to London and 15 minutes to Bath. The city has an international airport which provides routes to most major European destinations.
